@graph.name: Vegan Orange Cinnamon Christmas Cookies - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: These vegan orange cinnamon Christmas cookies are part of an online gluten-free and vegan holiday cookie party! They're super delicious and easy to make!

@graph.headline: Vegan Orange Cinnamon Christmas Cookies
@graph.keywords: Christmas cookies,Christmas cookies vegan recipe,cinnamon Christmas cookies,cinnamon cookies,cinnamon stars,easy Christmas cookies,easy vegan cookies,vegan Christmas,vegan Christmas cookies,vegan cinnamon cookies,vegan cinnamon orange cookies,vegan cookies,vegan gingerbread,vegan gingerbread cookies,vegan macaroons,vegan no bake balls,vegan orange cookies,vegan recipes for Christmas,Zimtsterne recipe

@graph.name: Vegan Orange Cinnamon Christmas Cookies
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup oat flour or whole wheat flour (Use oat flour to make the cookies gluten-free!)
about 1 to 1 1/2 tablespoons water or plant-based milk

recipeInstructions.text: First make the powdered brown sugar: Put the brown sugar (3/4 cup) in a blender and pulse for about 30-60 seconds until the sugar is powdered.
recipeInstructions.name: First make the powdered brown sugar: Put the brown sugar (3/4 cup) in a blender and pulse for about 30-60 seconds until the sugar is powdered.

recipeInstructions.text: If using oat flour do the same with the oats. Store-bought oat flour can be ridiculously expensive, but it's super easy to make at home and so much cheaper. Just place 3/4 cup of rolled oats in a food processor and pulse them until they have acquired a powder-like consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: If using oat flour do the same with the oats. Store-bought oat flour can be ridiculously expensive, but it's super easy to make at home and so much cheaper. Just place 3/4 cup of rolled oats in a food processor and pulse them until they have acquired a powder-like consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: On a floured board or baking parchment, roll out the dough to about 0.4 inch (1 cm) thickness and cut it into star shapes using a cookie cutter.
recipeInstructions.name: On a floured board or baking parchment, roll out the dough to about 0.4 inch (1 cm) thickness and cut it into star shapes using a cookie cutter.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the star-shaped cookies on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the star-shaped cookies on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 360 째F (about 180 째C) and bake for about 6-8 minutes. Make sure not to bake them too long, so they don't get hard. They're supposed to still be a bit soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 360 째F (about 180 째C) and bake for about 6-8 minutes. Make sure not to bake them too long, so they don't get hard. They're supposed to still be a bit soft.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the icing: Combine all ingredients and stir until smooth. If it is too thin, add more powdered sugar. Let the cookies cool down and spread them evenly  using a knife or the back of a spoon. Sprinkle them with some more cinnamon.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the icing: Combine all ingredients and stir until smooth. If it is too thin, add more powdered sugar. Let the cookies cool down and spread them evenly  using a knife or the back of a spoon. Sprinkle them with some more cinnamon.
